structure.unit: Nominations, Questions To Be Submitted To The Voters, Primaries And Caucuses

law.catch_line: Certificates Of Nomination And Nomination Papers; Objections; Filing
law.text: When certificates of nomination and nomination papers have been filed, and are in apparent conformity with the law, they shall be valid unless written objections are made. Such objections shall be filed, as to state offices, with the state secretary, and, as to city or town offices, with the city or town clerk in accordance with the provisions of chapter fifty-five B.
